author: nickyjacob
title: Legal Listings
description: Finding people who have legal and compliance knowledge is costly and inaccessible for new developers and entrepreneurs.

f6_assessments.q0:
Getting in contact with a legal professional who also has knowledge in web3 is challenging and difficult for blockchain entrepreneurs. This proposal tackles the challenge by connecting legal professionals and blockchain projects through their platform, called “Tokenlist”.

The proposal partially fails to mention how it would add value to the Cardano ecosystem. While it mentions that it would create a marketplace for legal workers and entrepreneurs, I would like more specific details on how that would help Cardano, because the voter could think that the solution proposed could also apply to other blockchains.

There’s also a lack of mention to future scalability. Some information regarding this topic would help the voter be more confident in this proposal’s ability to scale going forward.
f6_assessments.q1:
Concerning skills and experience necessary to implement the proposal, identification of team members as well as LinkedIn profiles and some general background are provided. Some complementary media articles are also proportioned. Regarding the team, the voter can find evidence through links and professional background information. Looking at this information, one can see that they have the ability to successfully implement their solution, since there’s a legal professional, a full stack developer and a PhD with experience in fintechs.

When it comes to the budget, it is divided into 2 sections which describe the tasks that will be worked on. A break-down of the budget is also visible to the voter, and will be divided between the developer’s salary and the legal professional’s wage. Considering the amount being asked, it seems reasonable when compared to the salary a professional in that field of work and same expertise would get.

A criterion that could contain more information is the timeline, which is provided in the same space as the budget. The proposal lists two phases which will last around 1-2 months each, and some general information for each section. Perhaps a bit more detail would make the timeline more understandable, and naming who will work on each task would also make it more transparent (although team members are listed, there’s no mention of what they will focus on). A mention of the resources needed would make the proposal more complete, too.

Finally, the proposal lists 2 potential risks and 2 ways to mitigate them. I consider these risks are possible, however, I see some more obvious ones, such as what to do when a person has a legal query which belongs to another jurisdiction and there’s no lawyer available for that. The proposal states that in that case, a worker of Tokenlist would help the costumer solve the query, however, there are reasonable doubts around the worker’s ability to solve a query concerning an international jurisdiction which he/she potentially has no knowledge of.
f6_assessments.q2:
Foremost, a roadmap is provided with some general milestones. There will be two phases and three milestones for each respective phase.

Regarding the metrics which will track the project’s progress, the team provides some useful as well as informative ones. For example, the latest code will be published in GitLab and will be available for anyone who’s interested. This is a great initiative because not only does it allow the voters to have a look at the actual code, but also contributes to the broader strategic goals for Fund9, which are to turn Cardano into an open source project, among others.

Finally, the team defines what success looks like in the short and long term. For example, for the short term, the project would be considered to be successful based on the number of legal queries posted and “legal team responding to each query a developer/entrepreneur”. This doesn’t seem too specific, and perhaps the team could define what number of legal queries would they consider enough. Besides, they could also clarify if success for them means having the legal team efficiently responding to a legal query or just responding.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is an excellent solution to the challenge of helping provide legal & financial services to funded projects and the entire Cardano community. 

Would have love to see a more call and response type detail describing how "your proposed solution will address the challenge."

The proposal has defined two risks with reasonable mitigation strategy for each.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal has provided details of a two phase timeline and milestone ...spanning 56 days? Each phase has three deliverable. 
Would have love to see more details about the human side of things. Who are the lawyers? What are their credentials? How will you source them? Will be be able to advice in any country? Things along those lines? 

The proposal has a detail breakdown of expenses and different types of costs. 

The tech and manage team is certainly update to task. Again would have love to hear more about the legal professions.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team has provided details about how they plan to manage and track the work internally. Would have love see where the "timely reports" will be posted for the community to follow along.

The are two definition of success, short and long term; would have love to see these tied directly back to the challenge's definition of success (in a call and response style) so the voter can easily access whether or not this platform is what the community asked for in the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: The issue of legal compliance is very paramount in our today's world and much attention should be geared toward legal issues. This challenge category prioritizes solutions created to help resolve legal and financial issues faced by funded proposals. Reviewing this proposal, I very much appreciate the solutions that the proposer aims to create to help resolve the challenge of finding people who have legal and compliance knowledge at a reduced cost for a project that has already received funding. This proposer has very well tried to provide a concise description with its problem statement and also provided a great solution to be implemented which looks at providing a marketplace having a pool of lawyers at an affordable rate. The Cardano ecosystem is gradually growing which needs these solutions to help add value to the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Teamwork is very important in every aspect of an activity or a project. reviewing the experience and skills of the team, they are of great talent and wonderful individual skills. Ricky Jacob is a PhD holder and also an ex-lead at google and can boast of over 15 years of experience. Rosemary also has over 7 years of experience as a legal professional and in the person of Amal C who is a full stack developer. This team in my view is a perfect combination to get this project done with a well-detailed implementable plan. I like the detailed budget breakdown that has been provided. There seems to be a good forecast for the funds for the project. Breaking down the cost into two phases helps us to appreciate the component of the budget very well.
f6_assessments.q2: The catalyst community need to be well informed about the progress and accomplishment of any project in the future and hence needs to be provided with sufficient information to help audit the success ratio. Given the road map, it can be seen that the project will be accomplished in phases. The first phase is seen to take 6 weeks and the second phase is also seen to take 50 days. The timing is well stated and looks okay to be attained. With regards to the metrics to be measured in line with the challenge category, i think we can look at the scalability of this project to scale very well into the future, all things being equal. looking at the use case of this project in relation to the challenge category, I think this project will surely be very useful to over 80% of most funded projects. I wish the team well to secure funding to embark on this project.

f6_assessments.q0:
I am a lawyer involved in providing legal guidance within Catalyst projects, but I do not usually offer legal advice to other projects. But probably the most common legal request that I get in Catalyst is for a referral to a lawyer who can advise on Catalyst projects. So a service like this is certainly needed. In addition, the idea of a legal listings service is squarely within the scope of this challenge. 

However, there is limited detail on how the service would work. I have been an investor in a well-funded legal referral business Lexoo (https://info.lexoo.com/), and it is a difficult business to make work, requiring expertise in the relevant areas of law. I would encourage the proposers to focus more on specific geographies and areas of legal practice to start this project (with the idea of expanding later), and explain how they will build a legal listing service in the selected niche(s). 

For these reasons, I agree but do not strongly agree that the proposed project would have strong impact of the type specified in the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team seems to have good start-up experience in the Indian market, and in Kerala in particular. However, more global experience is not clear. Also, the connection between the large number of media links provided for the team is not clear (I tried to understand how the links are connected to the team but was not able to do so). 

In addition, while Rosemary C has eight years of experience as a legal assistant, it would be preferable to have information on advice or connections from one or more lawyers. I would encourage the team to add such expertise to the team. 

As discussed under impact, the project plan is not very detailed. For example, there is very little technical detail on how the listings platform would be built (an API is mentioned). This proposal generally sets out a good idea, but I would encourage the team to spell out in more detail how they will implement it. 

The proposed budget is reasonable. 

Overall, I neither agree nor disagree that the project appears likely to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal sets out what are likely to be the key metrics for this type of project -- number of queries, response effectiveness and number of lawyers on the platform. If the feasibility challenges set out above could be managed, these would be good metrics to measure success.

However, the approaches described for tracking progress of the project are fairly general – task-based approach, use of Gitlab, reports, and API specification. More detail on these would be useful, particularly given the limited detail provided on project plan.

Therefore, I agree but do not strongly agree that this proposal provides sufficient information for auditability.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is helping young entrepreneurs to get service easily and cheaply for legal compliance. It is building a marketplace where entrepreneurs will make queries and receive legal responses. The most important feature is that every query shall have a response. Another special feature is the scheduling of meetings and streamlining payments throughout the process.

The proposer is a founder of Tokenlist and Paysack with knowledge and experience in Blockchain and fintech technology. The budget requested is 17000 USD

The proposal aims to expand and enlarge the community of developers and entrepreneurs within the Cardano ecosystem. With the proposal, more developers and entrepreneurs and the legal experts would be attracted to the Cardano community.

The risks the proposal faces are:
1 legal professional is not interested or fully committed. To mitigate, the proposal would resort to the professionals who are working with the proposers to attend to the unanswered query.
2. Enquirer not willing to have public posting of their queries. The proposers would create an anonymous option in their enquiries.

I see that the proposal encourages and supports human interactions, creating devices to connect humans in Cardano ecosystem solutions. These are all in line with the challenge and the campaign. With that, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan entails designing, developing and testing and onboarding. It takes 6 weeks to complete the whole system. It is proposed to take another 50 days to operate life so as to ensure everything is working as planned.

The total cost is 17000 USD which can be classified into two main parts, namely development cost and administration/operational  cost. The latter works directly for 2 hours per day for 50 days.

The team of 3 members are of experience relating to development and legal, relevant to this proposal.

I have these concerns, though:  I am missing out on reaching-out, promotion and on boarding efforts of getting the legal practitioners to register. I also missed this from the budget;  the ongoing operations after 50 days, how will the proposer handle as promised in the proposed solution that every query is answered.

The foregoing concern prompts me to settle for a rating of 4 instead of 5, that I agree that it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal is to host the code in Gitlab so that anyone can view and test ít. It also proposes that a "timely report" will be submitted, but I am not sure through what channel the reports are submitted, and I failed to understand the timeline of reporting. I also do not know the kind of report data I am expecting. 

According to the proposal, the short term success is based on the number of legal queries and the responses. The longer term success suggests the number of lawyers registered. The proposer does not state clearly how many lawyers are expected to register after  the 50 days test operation and within what time.

I have the above reservations and therefore I neither agree nor disagree that The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is to raise funds for the development of a marketplace that allows users to find a lawyer/lawyer consulting service for their projects. This idea is in line with the goal set by this Challenge and the theme is similar to most of the proposals presented in this Challenge. But in this proposal, there have been more developments, clear descriptions of the operating structure of the market they built, such as the form of receiving and processing customer needs, service items provided, etc. However, there are similar shortcomings that this proposal still suffers, that is not clear about the future growth of the project, which is related to the setting of targets for the key KPIs to measure the success of this Challenge. In addition, developing a new market is always associated with promotional marketing activities to able to attract users, and I have yet to find any information on marketing intentions/strategies for this proposer's market here.
f6_assessments.q1: The project development plan is divided into two main phases, the work for each phase is clear, and there are quite detailed estimates of the work time for each phase, but it is difficult to determine when those tasks will be started and finished if there is no defined timeline for them. Allocating budgets according to the formula of hours worked x respective remuneration is ideal for the auditability of the project. There are 4 working positions mentioned in this project, through the description of the working experiences of the members, we can determine the working position of each person in turn, Rosemary C will take on the role of Legal Expert, Amal C will be a Full Stack Developer and can also hold the position of Web Frontend UI/UX developer, however, Ricky Jacob's role is quite vague, I haven't figured out which of the 4 listed positions his work experience will relate to, the proponent needs more clarification on this.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal had specific descriptions of the tools they would use to manage and document the process and results of the project, and committed to making these data public to the community. However, the roadmap to evaluate the success of the project is not clear, the main measurement indicator given is "measured based on the number of legal queries posted and legal team responding to each query a developer/entrepreneur", but conceptualization is not enough for measurement without targets for KPIs and milestones to achieve established goals.

f6_assessments.q0: Getting lawyers who have knowledge over cardano are very hard to find these days ,since there is lot of demand for such lawyers the asking price of the lawyers are way to much for ordinary person, hence to set up market place, where people can get their lawyers or can get suggestions from lawyers is definitely a great idea , this will even help the non cardano users to join cardano eco system, where it will definitely boost them to use cardano and people will get a feel in the society as cardano ecosystem is safety to continue with. Hence ,this proposal effectively addresses the challenge
f6_assessments.q1:
The development of channel or a marketplace can be done by the proposer's team easily, since the proposer has experience of developing and has provided us with proven experience of contributing in 3+ business build on web3.
The main challenge that the proposer might find is finding the experienced or skilled lawyers and adding them into his portal/Channel , other than that  the plan has clear idea on how the queries will be passed to other lawyers, if any of the lawyers doesn't respond ,The team consist of all kinds of  members required for the project which includes experienced legal advisors and experienced UI/UX developers .Hence , with given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully
f6_assessments.q2:
The audit clearly explains about the experience of the proposer in development field related to block chain, the proposal has even introduced other team members who have expertise in legal professional.
The presented plan has clearly mentioned every step of proposed solution and how it'll counter the challenge mentioned, the presented plan decent phase wise timeline to complete the project, The presented plan has well developed budget feasible idea , With clear objective provided and decent key indicators mentioned the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal sets out to create a whole new legal and financial networking project built on the blockchain. If successful, this proposal would create something that would make a great impact toward reaching the challenge goals of improving access to sound legal and financial advice for projects and proposals running on Cardano. This proposal sadly is a step behind other similar proposals as they do not have an existing platform to tie into. They also will not be using any sort of DID or reputation system to enable ranking or rating of legal professionals. That being said, a plethora of such platforms would be healthy as some could target specific regions, or types of proposals.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal team has sufficient experience, and success in accomplishing the projects they set out to accomplish. There is sufficient detail on the team to assess that they are indeed capable of this project. But, the sufficient detail is not there for the budget or detailed plan. The detailed plan is not sufficiently detailed to assess feasibility. There are two phases of work in the plan. There are not enough specifics to determine how each phase will progress. There are no markers or KPIs set. Instead there is a statement that these would be dependent upon “feedback from the community.” There are enough proposals in this fund that have already done community outreach that it seems unrealistic to expect this to be a funded activity. Ideally, community engagement should have already begun so that we can assess the viability of this project. Successful projects are dependent upon active and engaged communities. The budget also lacks detail. Ideally the budget breakdown would include a more specific timeline than is provided. I do not doubt the team knows what is meant and is capable of completing this project, but I do wonder whether they will struggle with engaging a community after the platform is developed.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has experience working with Catalyst, and the auditability and clarity are present. There is a plan to provide the source code via gitlabs, and to submit regular reports. They acknowledge the need and plan to break the project down “into smaller tasks.” If they had done that already and included it in the proposal,that would have been a level of detail to assess this as more clear and auditable. Also, there are no clear metrics of success. There is nothing quantifiable or clearly measurable presented in the proposal. This needs to be re-worked before being submitted in a further fund. Or, ideally, the team could connect with an existing networking platform and work to further it.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a powerful proposal. The proposal poses the problem of creating a list of lawyers to give legal advice to the community. This problem is suitable for Challenge. It partially addresses Challenge's requirement, "How to provide legal services and solutions for sponsored proposals?". This proposal has a positive impact on proposals funded by the Catalyst fund and startups on the Cardano ecosystem. By providing a portfolio of attorneys who can support projects/companies in the Cardano ecosystem to operate legally. This proposal would solve the problem by building a Cardano-savvy attorney marketplace. At their platform, project developers who need support from the legal and compliance team can post their legal questions and issues for a quick and efficient response. They will use social media such as twitter, reddit, telegram, etc. to reach project developers wishing to use legal consulting services. This proposal is concerned with solving 3 main issues: the quality of consulting services (the category of integrated legal experts with web knowledge), the platform that allows users to post their queries, the support in as soon as possible (they will notify all legal professionals who can answer the question. If no one answers the question, their team will contact the legal professionals directly to make sure that they answer the question). . . I appreciate their arguments and ways of doing things. They seem to be very understanding of the legal problems that projects on the Cardano ecosystem are facing, including: they need legal experts with legal knowledge on web 3, legal issues that need to be addressed quick resolution to avoid delay, disruption of their projects, and especially, on this platform, project developers can consult other people's advice, as it is saved query. This is a treasure trove of data for project developers to learn from. Developers know how to grow and entrepreneurs know how to build businesses, but legal support can give them a confidence boost. The proposal presents two risks and their solutions. I agree with their solutions.
f6_assessments.q1: The team planned to implement the proposal. The proposal is expected to take a total of 92 days (about 13 weeks). The whole project is divided into two phases: system design and operation. However, they do not mention communication or marketing. At what stage of the project will they carry out the communication campaign? Besides, the group also did not mention that they would create a list of lawyers. Do they have enough lawyers? They just set the goal of completing the system's creation and putting it into operation. But unfortunately, there is no target on the number of lawyers who meet the requirements and the number of projects they approach for legal support. And most importantly, the community of interest is the customer's evaluation of the legal consulting service. They do not mention where the community will check the progress of the project. I ask the question: when the system is successfully created, can the community check their operating background? See questions from project developers and the list of attorneys they provide? This is a minus. In terms of budget, the fundraising budget accounts for less than 4% of the total challenge. Budget with a detailed spending plan for Full Stack Developers, User Interface, Legal Professionals, and Admins who are working directly. However, there is no budget for marketing communications and no additional projected budget. The budget spending plan needs to be re-examined. Regarding the team, their team consists of 3 members. But do not assign specific tasks to each member. Through identity verification via LinkedIn, through authentication, it can be seen that the member's relevant experience and qualifications are suitable for the jobs performed in this proposal. The Cardano community is very large, in many countries around the world, so providing a portfolio of lawyers of sufficient quantity and quality to support sponsored proposals is an issue that Challenge is looking to solve. The proposal has an idea but is unsure how to implement it. They should describe more clearly the list of lawyers they have connections with and options to attract cooperation from global lawyers to ensure quality advice for each funded proposal. Low feasibility score.
f6_assessments.q2: As described in the proposal, the short-term success of the project will be measured based on the number of legal queries posted and the legal team's answering each question from a developer/entrepreneur. The long-term success of the platform also depends on new attorneys signing up and engaging with the community. and the increase in the number of queries posted each month. However, they do not mention that they publicly report on the number of legal queries posted and the legal team responding, the number of attorneys, and the increase in the number of queries posted each month. Therefore, it is difficult to confirm whether the community can easily check the success of the project or not. I think the success of the project is to create a portfolio of lawyers with quality and quantity, knowledgeable about web 3 and ready to provide legal support and advice on solutions for project developers. That success will have a positive impact on Challenge, which is also an issue that Challenge needs to address to ensure Catalyst-funded projects can be started and operated legally, avoiding legal risks. unworthy. Note that this is a new proposal and has not yet been tested. I also don't appreciate the transparency of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The project was created to solve the problem of finding professionals with legal and compliance skills is expensive and difficult for new developers and companies. Tokenlist intends to create a marketplace for the Cardano legal and compliance staff. Younger developers who require assistance from the legal and compliance teams can expect an answer to their query placed on site.
Proposer described the work order with specific examples on social media like Twitter, Reddit, and Telegram. It is divided into three primary sections: hire legal professionals who are familiar with web3; developers and new entrepreneurs can publish their questions and make direct touch with the legal specialists; ensure that they react to the inquiry. More developers and entrepreneurs may join the Cardano ecosystem if the community goes beyond technical use cases and helps them with legal questions and connections. Developers and entrepreneurs know how to construct businesses, but legal assistance could help them gain confidence, and this is consistent with the contents of the challenge. The potential risks are specifically stated by the proposer with convincing solutions.
f6_assessments.q1:
The entire project is divided into two phases: designing the system and opening the application to the Cardano community. The proposer has provided a to-do list, with an estimated completion date, and is subject to change based on feedback from the community. Although the proposal's explanation is not too clear from a technical point of view, the above descriptions are sufficient to get a rough understanding of how the project is to be implemented.
The budget is allocated reasonably and follows the requested funds. It is allocated according to the work category and the number of hours performed. Specifically: $8000 for 200 hours full stack developer; $3000 for 100 hours web frontend UI/UX developer and $6000 for Legal Professional and admin who is working directly. I don't see any problem in this budgeting plan, because it's so clear I can understand how the cash flow works.
Team members are all software and legal experts with many years of experience working for law and technology firms. In addition, other supplementary categories are also provided to create a solid technical and legal foundation for this project.
f6_assessments.q2: The entire project will be divided into smaller tasks and shall be marked as done based on the progress, however, the proposer does not provide specific numbers on the expected number of customers, traffic, or interactions that can be achieved in the future. The project's short-term success will be determined by the number of legal queries posted and the legal team's response to each query submitted by a developer/entrepreneur. I suggest that the proposer add a more detailed roadmap that includes things like the expected date(month) of project start/ KPI numbers on the number of users, the number of interactions and the number of legal queries expected…/ time to complete activities to increase the persuasiveness of the project.

solution:
We are providing a marketplace were people can get a lawyer at an affordable rate.
This also enable the startup to create a concern note and get a lawyer to respond to it.
experience:
Founder of Tokenlist, Helped 3+ business build on web3.
https://thetokenlist.com/
Founder of Paysack, enabled multiple fintech founders launch their MVP without tech cofounders.
Have been part of accelerator : Techstars-Barclays Accelerator, SOSV Accelerator, KSUM, FintechYatra
